meanings.definition: A punctuation mark ( ) used to set off explanatory or qualifying remarks in writing.
meanings.sent1: In my essay, I used parentheses to add extra information about the topic.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to include parentheses when writing explanations in your report.
meanings.sent3: The parentheses in the sentence were like little side notes whispering secrets to the reader.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like parentheses, enclosing hidden meanings within the text.
meanings.sent5: The parentheses acted as a spotlight, drawing attention to important details in the text.

meanings.definition: Either of a pair of curved marks ( ) used to enclose a word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: She placed the word 'love' in parentheses to emphasize its significance.
meanings.sent2: Remember to use parentheses to group related words together in your sentence.
meanings.sent3: The parentheses around the word 'surprise' made it feel like a gift waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent4: His arms wrapped around her like parentheses, enclosing her in a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The parentheses hugged the word tightly, keeping it safe within their curved arms.
